intro: Psychotria crassiramula, commonly known as the thick-leafed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria crassiramula is also notable for its potential ethnobotanical uses in traditional medicine.
